description: Checks whether a date or dateTime provided in a metadata field adheres to the ISO 8601 standard.
message-fail: {date/dateTime} does not adhere to the ISO 1601 standard.
specification: is this a schema requirement? not sure if this is required by all metadata formats or not

description: Checks whether the data update time specified in a metadata record comes after the data 'insert' or 'create' time specified in the same metadata record. The update time indicates the time when the resource itself was last updated. The 'insert' or 'create' time indicates when the resource itself was first created. Logically, the 'insert' or 'create' time must be the same or come chronologically before the update time.
message-fail:
ECHO10:
Note: the LastUpdate time comes before the provided InsertTime.


DIF10.2 & DIF10.3:
Note: the Data_Last_Revision time comes before the provided Data_Creation time.


UMM-C/Common:
Note: the UPDATE Data Date comes before the provided CREATE Data Date.
remediation:
ECHO10:
Recommend updating the LastUpdate time so that it is identical to the InsertTime (in the event that the data has never been updated) or so that it comes chronologically after the InsertTime. 


DIF10.2 & DIF10.3:
Recommend updating the Data_Last_Revision time so that it is identical to the Data_Creation time (in the event that the data has never been updated) or so that it comes chronologically after the Data_Creation time. 


UMM-C/Common:
Recommend updating the UPDATE Data Date so that it is identical to the CREATE Data Date (in the event that the data has never been updated) or so that it comes chronologically after the CREATE Data Date.

description: Checks whether the delete time specified in a metadata record is in the future or in the past (in reference to the time the check gets applied). The delete time indicates the time when either the metadata record or the resource itself will be removed from the system. If the delete time is in the past, it indicates that the the delete time may need to be updated or removed from the metadata.
message-fail: Note: the delete date is in the past.
remediation: Consider updating the delete date to a future date or remove it from the metadata if it is no longer valid.

description: Checks whether the dataset title is identical to the dataset's short name. Typically, the short name is an abbreviated/shortened name of a dataset whereas the dataset title is a formal, human-readable name. Therefore, the dataset title should not be identical to the short name.
message-fail:
ECHO10:
Error: the DataSetId is identical to the ShortName.


DIF10.2 & DIF10.3:
Error: The Entry_Title is identical to the Short_Name.


UMM-C/Common:
Error: The EntryTitle is idenitcal to the ShortName.
remediation:
ECHO10:
Since DataSetId maps to Entry Title in the CMR, recommend providing a more descriptive, formal title for the dataset. 


DIF10.2 & DIF10.3:
Recommend providing a more descriptive, formal title for the dataset.


UMM-C/Common:
Recommend providing a more descriptive, formal title for the dataset.

description: Checks the health and status of any URL provided in a metadata field.
message-fail:
depends on output...
refer to URL checker code
specification: n/a - not required but would be a business rule

description: Checks the length of the descrption - if the length of the descrption is less than 100 characters it will prompt a warning since shorter descrpions may lack important contextual information.
message-fail: Warning: the abstract provided may be inadequate based on length.
remediation: Recommend providing a more comprehensive description, mimicking a journal abstract that is useful to the science community but also approachable for a first time user of the data.

description: Checks whether the metadata update time specified in a metadata record comes after the metadata 'insert' or 'create' time specified in the same metadata record. The update time indicates the time when the metadata record was last updated. The 'insert' or 'create' time indicates when the metadata record was first created. Logically, the 'insert' or 'create' time must be the same or come chronologically before the update time.

name-id: NASA DOI - Missing Reason Presence Check
name-display: NASA DOI - Missing Reason Presence Check
description: For NASA provider records, checks whether a DOI is provided. If no DOI is provided, it checks whether the metadata specifies that the DOI is missing. Stating that the DOI is missing indicates that it is not appropriate for the dataset to have a DOI and justifies the DOI not being provided.
message-fail:
ECHO10:
Error: No DOI or MissingReason provided. 


DIF10.2 & DIF10.3:



UMM-C/Common:
remediation:
ECHO10:
DOIs are required for NASA datasets. Recommend providing the DOI if one is available. Otherwise, specify that a DOI is not applicable for the dataset.


DIF10.2 & DIF10.3:



UMM-C/Common:

description:
Checks whether the DOI provided is valid by concatenating it with the prefix "https://doi.org/" and performing a URL check on the resulting URL. 
E.g. if the DOI in the metadata is "10.5067/AQR50-3R7CS" then runs a URL check on "https://doi.org/10.5067/AQR50-3R7CS"
message-fail:
ECHO10:
Error: {Collection/DOI/DOI} is invalid.


DIF10.2 & DIF10.3:



UMM-C/Common:
remediation:
ECHO10:
Error: {Collection/DOI/DOI} is invalid.


DIF10.2 & DIF10.3:



UMM-C/Common:

description: Checks whether the DOI Authority is "https://doi.org/" or "https://doi.org" for EOSDIS datasets, since this is the organization used to create persistent identifiers for NASA Earth science datasets.
message-fail:
ECHO10:
{Collection/DOI/Authority} may be an invalid value.


DIF10.2 & DIF10.3:



UMM-C/Common:
remediation:
ECHO10:
The DOI Authority should be "https://doi.org" for all NASA collections. 


DIF10.2 & DIF10.3:



UMM-C/Common:

description: Checks whether "Not Applicable" is used to populate the DOI/MissingReason field. "Not Applicable" is currently the only accepted value for this metadata field.
message-fail: Error: {DOI/MissingReason} is not a valid value.
remediation: The Missing Reason should read "Not Applicable"
specification:
ECHO10:
https://git.earthdata.nasa.gov/projects/EMFD/repos/echo-schemas/browse/schemas/10.0/MetadataCommon.xsd#680


DIF10.3 (this enumeration is not in 10.2):
https://git.earthdata.nasa.gov/projects/EMFD/repos/dif-schemas/browse/10.x/UmmCommon_1.3.xsd#600


UMM-C/Common:
https://git.earthdata.nasa.gov/projects/EMFD/repos/unified-metadata-model/browse/collection/v1.15/umm-cmn-json-schema.json#532

description: Checks the Collection Data Type field against a controlled vocabulary list.
message-fail: Error: {CollectionDataType} is not a valid value.
remediation:
ECHO10:
Recommend the Collection Data Type match one of the following values: [SCIENCE_QUALITY, NEAR_REAL_TIME, OTHER]


DIF10.2 & DIF10.3:
Recommend the Collection Data Type match one of the following values: [SCIENCE_QUALITY, NEAR_REAL_TIME, ON_DEMAND, OTHER]



UMM-C/Common:

name-id: Data Center Short Name GCMD Check
name-display: Data Center Short Name GCMD Check
description: Checks whether the value adheres to GCMD, specifically the provider list short name column.

name-id: ECHO10 Data Center Name Presence Check
name-display: ECHO10 Data Center Name Presence Check
description:
At least one DataCenter/ShortName must be provided per UMM requirements. Each of the following ECHO10 fields maps to DataCenter/ShortName & therefore at least one of the following ECHO10 fields need to be provided in order to satify this UMM requirement:
(a) Collection/ProcessingCenter
(b) Collection/ArchiveCenter
(c) Collection/Contacts/Contact/OrganizationName

Typically, the ArchiveCenter field is populated in ECHO10 records. If ArchiveCenter is not provided, checks whether 'ProcessingCenter' and/or 'Contacts/Contact/OrganizationName' are provided. If none of the fields are populated, this check will generate a recommendation to populate the ArchiveCenter field in order to meet the UMM requirement.

name-id: EOSDIS Standard Processing Level Id Check
name-display: EOSDIS Standard Processing Level Id Check
description: Checks the Processing Level Id against the official EOSDIS Data Processing Levels list: [ 0, 1A, 1B, 2, 3, 4 ]. Provides a warning if the provided Processing Level Id does not match a value from this list.
message-fail: {ProcessingLevelId} is not an EOSDIS recognized processing level ID.
remediation:
Recommend changing the ID to match one of the EOSDIS standard processing levels: 
[0, 1A, 1B, 2, 3, 4]

description: Checks the length of the description - if the length of the description is less than 50 characters it will prompt info since shorter descriptions may lack appropriate contextual information.
message-fail: The provided description is less than 50 charatcers and therefore may be lacking in contextual information.
remediation:
Recommend providing a more detailed processing level description, using the EOSDIS processing level descriptions as guidance:

https://science.nasa.gov/earth-science/earth-science-data/data-processing-levels-for-eosdis-data-products/
specification: not required but would be helpful for ARC reviewers

description: Check if the version description states only "Not provided" (could be mixed case: "not provided", Not Provided", etc.), provides info if it does
message-fail: The provided description reads only "Not provided"
remediation: Because the description reads "Not provided," it can be removed from the metadata. Otherwise, please describe the version in more detail.
specification: not required but would be helpful for ARC reviewers

description: Checks the Collection State against a controlled vocabulary list: [ACTIVE, PLANNED, COMPLETE, NOT APPLICABLE, NOT PROVIDED]. Provides an error if provided Collection State does not match a value from the controlled vocabulary list.
message-fail:
ECHO10:
The provided Collection State is invalid.


UMM-C/Common:
The provided Collection Progress is invalid.
remediation:
ECHO10:
Recommend choosing a Collection State from the following list: [ACTIVE, PLANNED, COMPLETE, NOT APPLICABLE, NOT PROVIDED].


UMM-C/Common:
Recommend choosing the Collection Progress from the following list: [ACTIVE, PLANNED, COMPLETE, NOT APPLICABLE, NOT PROVIDED].

description: <- for ECHO since it does not use a hierarchy
<- for DIF & UMM since they have a hierarchy

If EndsAtPresentFlag is populated:
true -> check EndingDateTime, if there is no ending date time passes check, if there is an EndingDateTime display a warning
true -> check CollectionState, if CollectionState = ACTIVE passes check, if CollectionState = COMPLETE display a warning
false -> check EndingDateTime, if there is an ending date time passes check, if there is not an EndingDateTime display a warning
false -> check CollectionState, if CollectionState = COMPLETE passes check, if CollectionState = ACTIVE display a warning
message-fail:
ECHO10:
- Potential issue with EndsAtPresentFlag: value = "true" but EndingDateTime is provided.
- Potential issue with EndsAtPresentFlag: value = "true" but CollectionState = COMPLETE.
- Potential issue with EndsAtPresentFlag: value = "false" but EndingDateTime is missing.
- Potential issue with EndsAtPresentFlag: value = "false" but CollectionState = ACTIVE.


DIF10.2 & DIF10.3:



UMM-C/Common:
remediation:
ECHO10:
If data collection is ongoing, recommend providing an EndsAtPresentFlag of "true"


DIF10.2 & DIF10.3:



UMM-C/Common:

description:
If EndsAtPresentFlag is not populated:
If no EndingDateTime is provided, print a warning that it might be necessary to add an EndsAtPresentFlag of 'true'
If an EndingDateTime is provided, passes check (no message needed)
If CollectionState = ACTIVE, print a warning that it might be necessary to add an EndsAtPresentFlag of 'true'
If CollectionState = COMPLETE, passes check (no message needed)
message-fail:
ECHO10:
- No EndingDateTime provided; no EndsAtPresentFlag provided for a potentially active collection.
- CollectionState = ACTIVE; no EndsAtPresentFlag provided for a potentially active collection. 


DIF10.2 & DIF10.3:



UMM-C/Common:
remediation:
ECHO10:
If data collection is ongoing, recommend providing an EndsAtPresentFlag of "true"


DIF10.2 & DIF10.3:



UMM-C/Common:

description:
Checks whether the UMM temporal requirement is met. One of 3 options must be provided:
(a) SingleDateTime
(b) RangeDateTime
(c) PeriodicDateTime

Checks whether the phone/contact type matches a value from the UMM schema enumeration list of contact mechanisms:
["Direct Line", "Email", "Facebook", "Fax", "Mobile", "Modem", "Primary", "TDD/TTY Phone", "Telephone", "Twitter", "U.S. toll free", "Other"]
message-fail:
ECHO10:
{Phone/Type} is not a valid phone type value.  

DIF10.2 & DIF10.3:



UMM-C/Common:
remediation:
ECHO10:
Recommend selecting a phone type from the following list:
{print contact mechanism enumeration list} 

DIF10.2 & DIF10.3:



UMM-C/Common:

description: Check to ensure Beginning Date Time is before Ending Date Time.  If not, provide an error. If they are the same, recommend a warning to supply a Single Date Time instead.
severity:
error - if Beginning time is not before Ending time

warning - if Beginning and Ending time are the same
message-fail:
error - The Beginning Date Time comes after the Ending Date Time

warning - The Beginning Date Time and Ending Date Time are the same
remediation:
error - Recommend updating the beginning and/or ending date time to match the granule extent.

warning - The temporal Beginning Date Time and Ending Date Time are identical. Recommend removing the Beginning Date Time and Ending Date Time elements and instead provide a Single Date Time of {"2012-09-18T00:00:00Z"}

name-id: Validate Beginning Date Time Against Granules
name-display: Validate Beginning Date Time Against Granules
description:
Checks whether the beginning date time matches the beginning date time of the first granule in the collection (if granules exist). 

Note: if only a date is provided (rather than a dateTime), then only the date needs to be compared.
remediation:
Recommend updating the Beginning Date Time to match the granule extent.

Note:
red/error: if the discrepancy is greater than or equal to 1 day/24 hours
yellow/warning: if the discrepancy is less than 1 day and if the collection level temporal extent does not include the full extent of the granules
blue/info: if the discrepancy is less than 1 day but the collection level temporal extent does include the full extent of the granules

name-id: Validate Ending Date Time Against Granules
name-display: Validate Ending Date Time Against Granules
description:
Checks whether the ending date time matches the ending date time of the last granule in the collection (if granules exist). 

Note: if only a date is provided (rather than a dateTime), then only the date needs to be compared.
remediation:
Recommend updating the Ending Date Time to match the granule extent.

Note:
red/error: if the discrepancy is greater than or equal to 1 day/24 hours
yellow/warning: if the discrepancy is less than 1 day and if the collection level temporal extent does not include the full extent of the granules
blue/info: if the discrepancy is less than 1 day but the collection level temporal extent does include the full extent of the granules

name-id: Validate Single Date Time Against Granules
name-display: Validate Single Date Time Against Granules
description: Checks whether Single Date Time matches the granule metadata. If Single Date Time is provided at the collection level, but the granule temporal metadata falls outside of the date/ dateTime range of the collection Single Date Time, then the collection level metadata needs to be updated.
Check to ensure Start Date is before End Date. Provide an error if this is not the case.
message-fail: The Start Date is not before the End Date. Recommend updating these fields to make sense logically.

description:
Checks whether the role/job position matches a value from the UMM schema enumeration list of contact roles:
["Data Center Contact", "Technical Contact", "Science Contact", "Investigator", "Metadata Author", "User Services", "Science Software Development"]
message-fail:
ECHO10:
{JobPosition} is not a valid Job Position value.  

DIF10.2 & DIF10.3:



UMM-C/Common:
remediation:
ECHO10:
Recommend selecting a Job Position from the following list:
{print contact role enumeration list} 

DIF10.2 & DIF10.3:



UMM-C/Common:

description:
Checks whether the Collection/Contact/Role matches a value from the controlled vocabulary list:
['ARCHIVER', 'DISTRIBUTOR', 'PROCESSOR', 'ORIGINATOR']
message-fail:
ECHO10:
{Contact Role} is not a valid Contact Role.
remediation:
ECHO10:
Recommend selecting a Contact Role from the following list:
['ARCHIVER', 'DISTRIBUTOR', 'PROCESSOR', 'ORIGINATOR']

description: Check whether the Collection/AdditionalAttributes/AdditionalAttribute/DataType matches a value from the controlled vocabulary list ["STRING", "FLOAT", "INT", "BOOLEAN", "DATE", "TIME", "DATETIME", "DATE_STRING", "TIME_STRING", "DATETIME_STRING"]
message-fail:
ECHO10:
{Data Type} is not a valid Data Type.
remediation:
ECHO 10:
Recommend selecting a Data Type from the following list:
["STRING", "FLOAT", "INT", "BOOLEAN", "DATE", "TIME", "DATETIME", "DATE_STRING", "TIME_STRING", "DATETIME_STRING"]

description: If 'http://dx.doi.org' is provided, recommend updating it to 'https://doi.org'
message-fail:
ECHO10:
Recommend updating "http://dx.doi.org" to "https://doi.org"
remediation: Recommend updating "http://dx.doi.org" to "https://doi.org"

description: Check to ensure the provided instrument short name matches a value from the GCMD controlled vocabularly list. Provide an  error if the provided short name is not an exact match with any of the names on the keyword list, and suggest a request be made to support@earthdata.nasa.gov in order to have it added to the GCMD Instrument KMS .
message-fail:
1. If the provided short name is not GCMD-compliant: The provided instrument short name does not comply with the GCMD. 
2. If an instrument short name is not provided: The instrument short name appears to be missing from the metadata.
remediation:
1. Please submit a request to support@earthdata.nasa.gov to have this instrument added to the GCMD Instrument KMS.
2. Recommend providing the following as the associated instrument short name under the [associated platform short name] platform.

description: Check to determine if the provided long name matches a value from the GCMD controlled vocabulary list and is associated with the correct instrument short name. Provide an  error if 1) a long name is not provided when one exists in the vocabulary list for the associated instrument short name or 2) if the provided long name is not an exact match with any of the names on the keyword list; suggest a request be made to support@earthdata.nasa.gov in order to have it added to the GCMD Instrument KMS if this is the case.
severity:
warning (if no long name is provided when it should be)

error (if the names is not an exact match with the keyword list)
message-fail:
1. If the provided long name is not GCMD-compliant: The provided instrument long name does not comply with the GCMD.
2. If a long name is not provided when one exists: The instrument long name appears to be missing from the metadata.
remediation:
1. Please submit a request to support@earthdata.nasa.gov to have this instrument added to the GCMD Instrument KMS.
2. Recommend providing the following as the associated instrument long name for [the instrument] under the [associated platform short name] platform.

description: Check to see if a characteristic is provided. If so, ensure that the characteristic name is a string between 1 and 80 characters.
message-fail: A characteristic name is missing for the provided characteristic.
remediation: Please provide a name for the provided characteristic.

description: Check to see if a characteristic is provided. If so, ensure that a characteristic description is also provided and is a string between 1 and 2,048 characters. Also look for grammatical errors if possible.
message-fail: A characteristic description is missing for the provided characteristic.
remediation: Please provide a short description for the provided characteristic.

description: Check to see if a characteristic is provied. If so, ensure that a characteristic unit is also provided and is a string is between 1 and 20 characters.
message-fail: A characteristic unit is missing for the provided characteristic.
remediation: Please provide the unit associated with the value of the provided characteristic.

description: Check to see if a characteristic is provided. If so, ensure that the characteristic value is a string between 1 and 80 characteristics.
message-fail: A characteristic value is missing for the provided characteristic.
remediation: Please provide a value for the provided characteristic.

description: Check if mime type is provided for URL types 'USE SERVICE API'. If present, check against controlled vocabulary list: ["application/json", "application/xml", "application/x-netcdf", "application/gml+xml", "application/vnd.google-earth.kml+xml", "image/gif", "image/tiff", "image/bmp", "text/csv", "text/xml", "application/pdf", "application/x-hdf", "application/xhdf5", "application/octet-stream", "application/vnd.google-earth.kmz", "image/jpeg", "image/png", "image/vnd.collada+xml", "text/html", "text/plain", "Not provided"]
severity:
1. if not provided: info

2. if provided and does not match controlled vocab: error
message-fail:
1. A mime type is not provided. 

2. {MimeType} is not a valid mime type.
remediation:
1. Recommend providing a mime type for each USE SERVICE API link.

2. Recommend selecting a Mime Type from the following list:
 ["application/json", "application/xml", "application/x-netcdf", "application/gml+xml", "application/vnd.google-earth.kml+xml", "image/gif", "image/tiff", "image/bmp", "text/csv", "text/xml", "application/pdf", "application/x-hdf", "application/xhdf5", "application/octet-stream", "application/vnd.google-earth.kmz", "image/jpeg", "image/png", "image/vnd.collada+xml", "text/html", "text/plain", "Not provided"]

description: Check if Collection/Spatial/HorizontalSpatialDomain/Geometry/Coordinate System matches a value on this list:  ["CARTESIAN", "GEODETIC"]
message-fail: {CoordinateSystem} is not a valid coordinate system.
remediation: Recommend selecting a Coordinate System from the following list: ["CARTESIAN", "GEODETIC"]

description: Check if Collection/ProductFlag matches a value on this list: ["DATA_PRODUCT_FILE", "INSTRUMENT_ANCILLARY_FILE", "SYSTEM/SPACECRAFT_FILE", "EXTERNAL_DATA"]
message-fail: {ProductFlag} is not a valid Product Flag.
remediation:
Recommend selecting a Product Flag from this list:
["DATA_PRODUCT_FILE", "INSTRUMENT_ANCILLARY_FILE", "SYSTEM/SPACECRAFT_FILE", "EXTERNAL_DATA"]

description: Check if Collection/Spatial/GranuleSpatialRepresentation field matches a value on this list: ["CARTESIAN", "GEODETIC", "ORBIT", " NO_SPATIAL"]
message-fail: {GranuleSpatialRepresentation} is not a valid Granule Spatial Representation.
remediation: Recommend selecting a Granule Spatial Representation from this list: ["CARTESIAN", "GEODETIC", "ORBIT", " NO_SPATIAL"]

description:
Check the /DIF/Private field against the following controlled vocabulary list:
["True", "False"]. If what is provided does not match a value from this list, provide an error.
message-fail: {Private} is not a valid Private value.
remediation: Recommend selecting a value from the following list: ["True", "False"]

description:
Check the /DIF/DatasetCitation/PersistentIdentifier/Type field against the controlled vocabulary list:
["DOI", "ARK"]. If what is provided does not match a value from this list, provide an error.
message-fail: {Persistent Identifier Type} is not a valid Persistent Identifier Type.
remediation: Recommend selecting a value from the following list: ["DOI", "ARK"]

description: Check the /DIF/Personnel/Role field against the controlled vocabulary list: ["INVESTIGATOR", "INVESTIGATOR, TECHNICAL CONTACT", "METADATA AUTHOR", "METADATA AUTHOR, TECHNICAL CONTACT", "TECHNICAL CONTACT"]. If what is provided does not match a value from this list, provide an error.
message-fail: {Personnel Role} is not a valid Personnel Role.
remediation: Recommend selecting a value from the following list: ["INVESTIGATOR", "INVESTIGATOR, TECHNICAL CONTACT", "METADATA AUTHOR", "METADATA AUTHOR, TECHNICAL CONTACT", "TECHNICAL CONTACT"]

description: Check the /DIF/Organization/Personnel/Role field against the controlled vocabulary list: ["DATA CENTER CONTACT"]. If what is provided does not match a value from this list, provide an error.
message-fail: {Organization Personnel Role} is not a valid Organization Personnel Role.
remediation:
Recommend selecting a value from the following list:
["DATA CENTER CONTACT"]

description: Check the /DIF/Temporal_Coverage/Periodic_DateTime/Duration_Unit field against the controlled vocabulary list: ["DAY", "MONTH", "YEAR"]. If what is provided does not match a value from this list, provide an error.
message-fail: {Duration Unit} is not a valid Duration Unit.
remediation:
Recommend selecting a value from the following list:
["DAY", "MONTH", "YEAR"]

description: Check to ensure Start Date is before Stop Date. Provide an error if this is not the case.
message-fail: The Start Date is not before the Stop Date. Recommend updating these fields to make sense logically.

description: This check ensures that the DIF10 Entry ID field and the Short Name field are not identical. If it does, provide an error.
message-fail: The Entry ID and the Collection's Short Name are identical. Recommend providing a more descriptive Entry ID.

description: Check against controlled vocabulary list ["Horizontal", "HorizontalVertical" , "Orbital" , "Vertical", "Horizontal&Vert"]
message-fail: The Spatial Coverage Type provided is invalid. Recommend providing a spatial coverage type from the following list: ["Horizontal", "HorizontalVertical" , "Orbital" , "Vertical", "Horizontal&Vert"]
